ConvGRU

https://github.com/jhhuang96/ConvLSTM-PyTorch/blob/master/ConvRNN.py

In a GRU cell the outputs and hidden are the same, last output must be equal to last hidden.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class ConvGRUCell[source]

ConvGRUCell(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size=(3, 3), bias=True, activation=tanh, batchnorm=False) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cgru_cell = ConvGRUCell(16, 32, 3)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cgru_cell(torch.rand(1, 16, 16, 16)).shape

torch.Size([1, 32, 16, 16])
{% endraw %}

Let's check:

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class ConvGRU[source]

ConvGRU(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size, n_layers, batch_first=True, bias=True, activation=tanh, input_p=0.2, hidden_p=0.1, batchnorm=False) :: Module

Base class for all neural network modules.

Your models should also subclass this class.

Modules can also contain other Modules, allowing to nest them in a tree structure. You can assign the submodules as regular attributes::

import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.conv1(x))
        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

Submodules assigned in this way will be registered, and will have their parameters converted too when you call :meth:to, etc.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cgru = ConvGRU(16, 32, (3, 3), 2)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cgru

ConvGru(in=16, out=32, ks=(3, 3), n_layers=2, input_p=0.2, hidden_p=0.1)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
layer_output, last_state_list = cgru(torch.rand(8,10,16,6,6))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
layer_output.shape

torch.Size([8, 10, 32, 6, 6])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
last_state_list.shape

torch.Size([2, 8, 32, 6, 6])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
layer_output, last_state_list = cgru(torch.rand(8,10,16,6,6), last_state_list)
{% endraw %}

DCGAN image encoder/decoder

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class dcgan_conv[source]

dcgan_conv(nin, nout, stride) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class dcgan_upconv[source]

dcgan_upconv(nin, nout, stride) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dcgan_conv(1,10,1)

dcgan_conv(
  (0): Conv2d(1, 10, kernel_size=(3, 3), stride=(1, 1), padding=(1, 1))
  (1): GroupNorm(4, 10, eps=1e-05, affine=True)
  (2): LeakyReLU(negative_slope=0.2, inplace=True)
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dcgan_upconv(1,10,1)

dcgan_upconv(
  (0): ConvTranspose2d(1, 10, kernel_size=(3, 3), stride=(1, 1), padding=(1, 1))
  (1): GroupNorm(4, 10, eps=1e-05, affine=True)
  (2): LeakyReLU(negative_slope=0.2, inplace=True)
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class image_encoder[source]

image_encoder(nc=1) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class image_decoder[source]

image_decoder(nc=1) :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
img_encoder = image_encoder()
img_decoder = image_decoder()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
enc_img = img_encoder(torch.rand(1,1,64,64))
enc_img.shape

torch.Size([1, 64, 16, 16])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
img_decoder(enc_img).shape

torch.Size([1, 1, 64, 64])
{% endraw %}

class Seq2Seq[source]

Seq2Seq(seq_len=2, ch_out=1, ks=3, n_layers=1, debug=False) :: Module

Simple seq2seq model

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
m = StackUnstack(Seq2Seq(5, 1, debug=True), dim=1)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
imgs_list = [torch.rand(2,1,64,64) for _ in range(10)]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
out, enc_imgs, enc_targets = m(imgs_list)
assert len(enc_imgs)==len(enc_targets)
len(out), out[0].shape, enc_imgs[0].shape, enc_targets[0].shape

pr:  0.0
enc_imgs shape torch.Size([2, 10, 64, 16, 16])
initial out: torch.Size([2, 1, 1, 64, 64])
i out: torch.Size([2, 1, 1, 64, 64])
i out: torch.Size([2, 1, 1, 64, 64])
i out: torch.Size([2, 1, 1, 64, 64])
i out: torch.Size([2, 1, 1, 64, 64])

(5,
 torch.Size([2, 1, 64, 64]),
 torch.Size([2, 1, 64, 64]),
 torch.Size([2, 1, 64, 64]))
